title: Indian Engineers Supremacy
selftext:
I have never seen so many typos together at one place in a consumer facing page ever.

Amazon India didn‚Äôt even bother to check the spellings or is this the new GenZ lingo we all must accustomed to now.
comments: Thnk u for this post stelp brother
First of all, when did amazon started selling scooters?
Cause getting and managing dealers to give consistent customer service is hard...

Select vehicle from vehicle 
As opposed to select vehicle from not vehicle

And here's a lil bit of AmazonIN mathematics

https://preview.redd.it/tzhj4pgp004e1.jpeg?width=540&format=pjpg&auto=webp&s=2883b2c76028e32f3d595a43660c1ac3acb5ddc5
If it said `select vehicle from vehicles` I'd legit think it was coder writing this

Amazon is an aggregator. The listing of products is done by the seller who is selling the product. Amazon doesn't need to bother about what the seller puts up. If companies don't present their products well, it affects only the seller.
Prices are decided by the seller and not Amazon. Amazon is simply a platform that charges a fee for selling a product.
See the price calculation per 100 grams. Doesn't Amazon have basic converter integrated into it's software?

It could be something to do with the seller not entering the details properly. For example, you may see that it says 4 kg, but it could be written in the description, but the actual weight not entered correctly in the weights column. It could also have been done intentionally because the Amazon fees is calculated based on the weight.

Scroll down to the product weight of all the different weights. It shows as 1 Kg. So based on what the seller has entered, it is correct.

https://preview.redd.it/1d8mvcy8704e1.jpeg?width=720&format=pjpg&auto=webp&s=f8bcd5bf043ff32fbd14a26077a915053cc8de0d
Why should flipkart have all the fun?

This isn‚Äôt a seller page to be honest. This is just Amazon advertising one of their marketplaces and procedures about how to use their app. This is a landing page. Seller listing is below. I guess anyone can see that.
